intro: Grevillea meisneri, commonly known as the narrow-leaved grevillea, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and clusters of bright red or orange flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It is a member of the Proteaceae family, which includes many other ornamental and ecologically significant plants. Grevillea meisneri is often cultivated for its attractive appearance and ability to attract native birds and insects.
